message:
An important statement yesterday by the spokesperson of the American State Department, regarding the lawsuits against Israel for the war in Gaza:

We believe that the International Criminal Court in The Hague has no jurisdiction in this matter.

message:
Hezbollah announces a death in its ranks:

Vahid Tefili, born in 2000 from the village of Deir al-Zahrani in southern Lebanon.

Vahid was seriously injured more than four days ago and died tonight from his wounds. The circumstances of his death are not specified.
In addition to being a Hezbollah military operative, he was a "commander" in the local Hezbollah scout tribe.

Number 291
event_breakdown:
- Hezbollah announces death of Vahid Tefili, born in 2000 from Deir al-Zahrani village in southern Lebanon.
- Vahid, a Hezbollah military operative and "commander" in local Hezbollah scout tribe, dies from serious injuries sustained over four days ago.
- Circumstances of his death not specified.

message: It is important to emphasize: as written in the title above 👆, this is the proposal that Israel allegedly forwarded to Hamas. That is, if the report is true, then Israel has agreed to these terms and Hamas has not yet...
event_breakdown:
1. Israel has reportedly proposed an agreement to Hamas.
2. The proposed agreement includes provisions for a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.
3. If the reports are accurate, Israel has agreed to certain terms outlined in the proposal.
4. Hamas has not yet responded to the proposed agreement.

message:
The operation in Rafah - the Lebanese Al-Akhbar newspaper (Hezbollah-affiliated) from its sources:

The US demands that Israel evacuate at least 800,000 displaced people from Rafah before the attack in the area. 40,000 tents arrived in Israel from China, paid for by the United Arab Emirates. Each tent can accommodate 20 people (a total of 800,000 people).

There is a concentration of about a thousand IDF vehicles, including tanks and APCs in the southern area of ​​the Gaza Strip (on the Israeli side).
Israel is planning to break into Rafah from the area of ​​the Sofa crossing and the Kerem Shalom crossing.

The Egyptians asked to check with the leadership of Hamas, whether its military arm is planning to blow up the fences in the border area with Egypt in order to cause crowds to flee to Egyptian territory.
event_breakdown:
- US demands evacuation of displaced people from Rafah
- Arrival of 40,000 tents from China paid for by UAE
- Concentration of IDF vehicles in southern Gaza Strip
- Israel planning to break into Rafah from Sofa and Kerem Shalom crossings
- Egyptians inquire about Hamas military arm's intentions to blow up fences bordering Egypt

message:
Florida: Security forces dispersed a demonstration on the campus of the University of South Florida by firing tear gas.

Pro-Palestinian rioters were also arrested there.
event_breakdown:
- Security forces disperse demonstration on University of South Florida campus in Florida by firing tear gas.
- Pro-Palestinian rioters arrested during the demonstration.

message: NYPD buses with the detainees from tonight leave the grounds of Columbia University.
event_breakdown:
- Missile attack targets educational institution in Odesa's seafront park, killing five and injuring 32.
- Roof of private law academy destroyed in strike in Odesa.
- Odesa Mayor Trukhanov expresses shock in Telegram video following the attack.
- President of academy, former MP Serhiy Kivalov, among the injured, reports public broadcaster Suspilne.
- Odesa continues to face frequent Russian missile and drone attacks, with port infrastructure being a particular target.

- Iran launches around 300 weapons from Iran, Syria, and Yemen, including ballistic missiles, land-attack cruise missiles, and unmanned aerial vehicles.
- Attack characterized as major effort by Iran to inflict pain on Israel.
- Only a few Iranian weapons penetrate defenses, causing little material damage.
- Hypothetical scenario raised: consequences if all 300 Iranian weapons had penetrated defenses.

- Houthi rebels from Yemen launch missile attack in Red Sea.
- Attack damages ship in latest assault targeting maritime traffic in strategic waterway.

- 16-year-old Sydney boy charged with terrorism offenses denied bail due to concerns for community safety.
- Court hears boy messaged another young person stating "we're going to kill."
- Six teenagers charged after counter-terrorism raids in Sydney, two appear in children's court at Parramatta.
- Text message presented in court suggests planning for a terrorist attack.
- Parents of 16-year-old describe him as an "excellent son" and good student in affidavit.
- Material allegedly includes video of assault with Islamic State symbol watermarked over it.

- NYPD buses with the detainees from tonight leave the grounds of Columbia University.

message:
US media channels reports that the NYPD arrested about a hundred people on Columbia University's campus.

In a statement, Columbia University claimed that the leaders of the protest on campus are not even students of the university, but rather external parties.

The president of the university asked the police forces to remain on the university campus until May 17th to maintain order and make sure that no tent camps are set up on campus.
event_breakdown:
- NYPD arrests about a hundred people on Columbia University's campus
- Columbia University states that protest leaders are not students but external parties
- University president requests police to stay on campus until May 17th

message: At the center of it all - the removal of the Palestinian rioters occupying Hamilton Hall, which they had vandalized while taking over the building and barricading themselves inside.
event_breakdown:
- Palestinian rioters occupying Hamilton Hall removed from building they had vandalized.
- Rioters barricaded themselves inside the building before being removed.

message: New York: In the last few hours, the signal was finally given and the New York police entered Columbia University in large forces to disperse the hate demonstration against Israel.
event_breakdown: - New York police enter Columbia University in large forces to disperse hate demonstration against Israel.

message:
Tomorrow will be a month since the last attack attributed to Israel in Damascus, the capital of Syria - the attack in which Muhammad Reza Zahedi, the commander of the Quds Force in the Iranian Revolutionary Guards in the Syrian and Lebanese sector, was killed.

According to Syrian sources, this is the longest quiet period in the skies of Damascus in recent years.

Is the Iranian deterrence working?
event_breakdown:
- One month since last attack attributed to Israel in Damascus, Syria.
- Attack resulted in death of Muhammad Reza Zahedi, commander of Quds Force in Iranian Revolutionary Guards in Syrian and Lebanese sector.
- Syrian sources note longest period of quiet in skies of Damascus in recent years.
- Question raised: Is Iranian deterrence working?

message: The Houthis, Iran's loyalists in Yemen, publish documentation of a UAV they launched yesterday at the Greek ship CYCLADES, according to the US Central Command, there were no casualties as a result and the ship continued on its way. Damage was not denied.
event_breakdown:
- The Houthis launch a UAV at the Greek ship CYCLADES in Yemen
- According to the US Central Command, there were no casualties
- The ship continued on its way
- Damage to the ship was not denied

message:
About Al Jazeera:
The Qatari network will soon broadcast a special program in which it will glorify and praise Yahya Sinwar, the leader of Hamas in the Gaza Strip - "the man who managed to put the whole world on one foot".
event_breakdown: - Al Jazeera is planning to broadcast a special program praising Yahya Sinwar, the leader of Hamas in the Gaza Strip.

message:
A young Jewish man does not allow Al Jazeera's reporter, Najwan Simri, to broadcast a report (which is not sympathetic to Israel, to put it mildly) regarding the stabbing attack by the Turkish citizen today in the Old City of Jerusalem.
He repeats to the camera: don't listen to their nonsense.
She later turns to the Israeli police stationed in the area, complaining about the young man and falsely claiming he is touching her.
It is worth noting they are members of the same force (Israeli Border Police) that was attacked.
event_breakdown:
1. A young Jewish man prevents Al Jazeera reporter Najwan Simri from broadcasting a report on a stabbing attack by a Turkish citizen in the Old City of Jerusalem.
2. The young man addresses the camera, advising viewers not to listen to "their nonsense."
3. Najwan Simri complains to Israeli police in the area about the young man and falsely accuses him of touching her.
4. Both the young man and Najwan Simri are members of the Israeli Border Police force that was previously attacked.

message: Members of the Palestinian Authority's security forces confront Palestinian protesters near the Canadian Embassy in Ramallah. The protesters are protesting Canada's support for Israel regarding the fighting in Gaza.

- The protesters are protesting Canada's support for Israel regarding the fighting in Gaza.

message:
The military arm of the Islamic Jihad in Jenin is trying to thwart the entry of the undercover forces into the refugee camp and placed signs with instructions for the driving public:

2. At night, the interior light in the car must be turned on.
3. Owners of commercial vehicles - your vehicle will be checked before entering the area.
event_breakdown:

message:
The Israel Police publishes CCTV footage of today's stabbing attack near the Flowers Gate in the Old City of Jerusalem.

The Turkish terrorist stalked the two police officers from behind, and then pulled out a knife and started stabbing one of two.

Thankfully the officers managed to fight him off, sustaining only minor injuries.

As previously mentioned, the terrorist was shot and killed.

2. Turkish terrorist stalks two police officers and stabs one

message:
The Lebanese government's crisis management team publishes data on the war with Israel.

Since October 7, 4010 air and ground attacks have been carried out on targets in Lebanon.

The 5 villages that were attacked the most are:
Ayta ash Shab - 339 times
Hula - 311 times
Naqoura - 256 times
Aalma ech Chaab - 241 times
Tayr Harfa - 215 times.

The team also reported that since October 7th, 438 people have been killed in Lebanese territory, of which 337 are militants (Hezbollah and other organizations), 100 civilians and one Lebanese soldier.
event_breakdown:
- Lebanese government's crisis management team publishes data on war with Israel.
- Since October 7, 4010 air and ground attacks carried out on targets in Lebanon.
- Five villages attacked the most: Ayta ash Shab (339 times), Hula (311 times), Naqoura (256 times), Aalma ech Chaab (241 times), Tayr Harfa (215 times).
- Since October 7, 438 people killed in Lebanese territory: 337 militants (Hezbollah and other organizations), 100 civilians, and one Lebanese soldier.

message:
Last night, the American Central Command published pictures of the progress of the construction of the floating pier off the coast of Gaza.

At the same time, there are reports that the British are considering sending soldiers on their behalf to secure the pier.
event_breakdown:

- Reports suggest that the British are considering sending soldiers to secure the pier.

message:
More about the anti-Semitic demonstrations on US campuses:

MIT University issued an ultimatum to students to end the protest within 24 hours.

Columbia University began suspending students who did not end the protest.
event_breakdown:
- Prime Minister and Minister Ben Gvir make two public promises regarding entry to Rafah. Arab and Palestinian media extensively quote the promises.
- NYPD buses with the detainees from tonight leave the grounds of Columbia University.
- Missile attack targets educational institution in Odesa's seafront park, killing five and injuring 32. Roof of private law academy destroyed in strike in Odesa. Odesa Mayor Trukhanov expresses shock in Telegram video following the attack. President of academy, former MP Serhiy Kivalov, among the injured, reports public broadcaster Suspilne. Odesa continues to face frequent Russian missile and drone attacks, with port infrastructure being a particular target.
- Iran launches around 300 weapons from Iran, Syria, and Yemen, including ballistic missiles, land-attack cruise missiles, and unmanned aerial vehicles. Attack characterized as major effort by Iran to inflict pain on Israel. Only a few Iranian weapons penetrate defenses, causing little material damage. Hypothetical scenario raised: consequences if all 300 Iranian weapons had penetrated defenses.
- Houthi rebels from Yemen launch missile attack in Red Sea. Attack damages ship in latest assault targeting maritime traffic in strategic waterway.
- 16-year-old Sydney boy charged with terrorism offenses denied bail due to concerns for community safety. Court hears boy messaged another young person stating "we're going to kill." Six teenagers charged after counter-terrorism raids in Sydney, two appear in children's court at Parramatta. Text message presented in court suggests planning for a terrorist attack. Parents of 16-year-old describe him as an "excellent son" and good student in affidavit. Material allegedly includes video of assault with Islamic State symbol watermarked over it.
- Survey by Harvard Harris Institute shows clear majority among American public for military operation in Rafah. 72% of respondents support operation in Rafah.
- MIT University issued an ultimatum to students to end the protest within 24 hours.
- Columbia University began suspending students who did not end the protest.

message:
Kevin Stitt, Governor of Oklahoma (Republican) on the protesters for Hamas:

This is a small and vocal minority that must bear responsibility for its actions.

I wish they would have seen the GoPro camera videos of Hamas operatives from Oct 7th

I would kick them out of the colleges.

They need a psychiatric evaluation.

There is no place for hate speech in Oklahoma.
event_breakdown:
- Kevin Stitt, Governor of Oklahoma (Republican) makes statements regarding protesters for Hamas
- Stitt wishes protesters would have seen GoPro camera videos of Hamas operatives from October 7th
- Stitt calls for protesters to be kicked out of colleges and undergo psychiatric evaluation
- Stitt emphasizes there is no place for hate speech in Oklahoma.

message: And how it ended
event_breakdown:
- Protesters clash with police at Taksim Square in Istanbul
- Demonstrators occupy Gezi Park to prevent its demolition
- Protests spread to other cities in Turkey including Ankara and Izmir
- Government cracks down on protesters with tear gas and water cannons
- International condemnation of government's handling of protests
- Government eventually agrees to halt the park's redevelopment
- Protests gradually dissipate as government offers minor concessions and uses force to clear the demonstrations.

message:
Must watch:
This is how a Palestinian described his visit to the Auschwitz-Birkenau extermination camp in a video shared on Gaza channels:

His take is not out of the ordinary among Palestinians.
